skillTree.localised_description: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit is Undead (does not rout, immune to terror, becomes unstable when Leadership is low).

skillTree.localised_description: The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit is Undead (does not rout, immune to terror, becomes unstable when Leadership is low).

skillTree.localised_description: Giant leonine statues, almost impervious to harm; they wade through foes, crushing them like bothersome insects.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit is Undead (does not rout, immune to terror, becomes unstable when Leadership is low).
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee.
When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus

skillTree.localised_description: The pain of immortal misery, coupled with insane violence, characterises the return to Unlife for many of the Tomb Kings, who fight longer, harder and better than they ever could before.
You cannot build an empire without sacrificing a few sons…
The fluid used to embalm the Tomb King toughens his bindings, enabling him to withstand a greater degree of damage than would otherwise be possible.
Soaked in and toughened by embalming fluid, the cloth bindings used to mummify afford the wearer additional protection from all but a direct hit from mortal projectiles.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_name: Khsar: Patron of the Rakaph Dynasty
skillTree.localised_description: The dynastic line of Rakaph has always held a special place for the God of Deserts. All gods are worshipped by them, but Khsar in his form of the desert wind is first and formost.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 when fighting in desert terrain
	(Lord's army)
Ability number of uses: +3 for " Khsar's Sandstorm"

skillTree.localised_description: The Priests of the Mortuary Cult of the Rakaph Dynasty beseech their Patron Khsar to release further energies from the Realm of Souls to aid your forces.

effects.description:
Ability number of uses: +1 for "Realm of Souls Tier 1"
	(all armies factionwide)

enabled_if: Realm of Souls Tier 1 is reached

effects.description:
Ability number of uses: +1 for "Realm of Souls Tier 2"
	(all armies factionwide)

enabled_if: Realm of Souls Tier 2 is reached

skillTree.localised_name: Entombed Beneath the Sands: Skeleton Warriors
skillTree.localised_description: Skeleton Warriors prepare the battlefield ahead by entombing themselves behind the enemy lines, ready to spring forth and surprise your opponent when the battle starts.

effects.description:
Attribute: Vanguard Deployment for Skeleton Spearmen and Skeleton Warriors units
	(all armies factionwide)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +3 for Skeleton units
	(all armies factionwide)

Attribute: Stalk for Skeleton Spearmen and Skeleton Warriors units
	(all armies factionwide)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

skillTree.localised_name: Khsar's Desert Wind: Ushabti and Warsphinx's
skillTree.localised_description: Harnessing the power of Khsar, god of the desert winds, the Mortuary Cult has imbued its statues with the desert wind which engulfs them and carries them across the battlefield.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +10 for Khemrian Warsphinx, Skeleton Chariot and Skeleton Archer Chariot units
	(all armies factionwide)

Bonus vs Large: +20 for Necrosphinx and Khemrian Warsphinx units
	(all armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: The Mortuary Cult of the Rakaph Dynasty can summon the forces of their Patron even to snow-topped mountains. To bake his worshippers enemy's in the heat of the deep desert, creating intolerable conditions to see out a siege. And the sand. It gets everywhere.

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +25% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Enemy leadership: -8 when enemy lays siege or encircles
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Khsar's might shines down upon his children, protecting them from afar.

effects.description:
Ability number of uses: +1 for "Realm of Souls Tier 3"
	(all armies factionwide)

enabled_if: Realm of Souls Tier 3 is reached

skillTree.localised_description: The Mortuary Cult delve deeply from the Realm of Souls, reaching into Khsar's Great Desert Beyond itself to pluck forth his mightest heroes.

effects.description:
Army ability Realm of Sand: +1 uses for "Realm of Souls Ushabti"
	(all armies factionwide)

enabled_if: Realm of Souls Tier 3 is reached

skillTree.localised_description: It is not possible to defeat such unshakeable spirit once its owner's mind is made up.
Kill many and you *are* a conqueror; godhood is then but a protracted slaughter away...
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
He whose will transcends death can strike out from beyond the grave, to devastating effect.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Death is not an impedance to the strongest of wills.
Beware the scorpion's sting, hidden 'neath the desert sands yet always poised to strike.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: The promise of a glorious afterlife worthy of a courageous warrior keeps embattled troops focused on the grim task at hand.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Carrying the blessing of the goddess Asaph, these arrows seek out the foe with unerring accuracy.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +8% for Skeleton Archers, Vulture Legion, Nehekhara Archers, Tomb Guard Archers, Royal Archers, Screaming Skull Catapult, Bone Thrower and Bone Giant units

skillTree.localised_description: Death isn't necessarily the end; those who have pledged service must rise to fight again another day.

skillTree.localised_description: Formed by long campaigns and bloody slaughter in the stifling desert heat, the bond between steed and rider cannot be broken, even when death tries to intervene.

skillTree.localised_description: "The swift charioteers of the king. They who pursue the sovereign's foes on the day of his awakening."

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Simple stone is afforded more respect than other materials, for from its grain giant guardians are hewn, brought to shuddering life by the Liche Priests' sorcery.

Melee defence: +4 for Hierotitan, Necrolith Colossus, Khemric Titan, Ushabti and Ushabti (Great Bow) units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +9% for Ushabti (Great Bow) units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Not even stone is set in stone it seems – arcane death magic is used to bring tortured, savage vigour to once-dormant stone sentinels.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +6 for Sepulchral Stalkers, Necrosphinx and Tomb Scorpion units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Sepulchral Stalkers, Necrosphinx and Tomb Scorpion units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for Sepulchral Stalkers, Necrosphinx and Tomb Scorpion units

	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +8 for Sepulchral Stalkers, Necrosphinx and Tomb Scorpion units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It takes an iron will and unnatural - supernatural - strength to rally bound troops routed by magical means.
Arrows loosed under the ever-watchful eye of the Serpent Goddess find their marks with divine precision.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +15% for Skeleton Archers, Ushabti (Great Bow), Skeleton Horse Archers, Screaming Skull Catapult and Bone Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Skeleton Archers, Vulture Legion, Nehekhara Archers, Tomb Guard Archers, Royal Archers, Ushabti (Great Bow), Skeleton Horsemen Archers, Nehekhara Horsemen Archers, Screaming Skull Catapult, Bone Thrower and Bone Giant units (Rank 7 and above)

Missile resistance: 15% for Skeleton Archers, Ushabti (Great Bow), Skeleton Horse Archers, Screaming Skull Catapult and Bone Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The desert itself is his steed.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Nehekhara Horsemen, Skeleton Horsemen, Tomb Guard Horsemen, Sepulchral Stalkers, Serpent Guard, Nehekhara Knights, Tomb Barque and Chariot units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Nehekhara Horsemen, Skeleton Horsemen, Tomb Guard Horsemen, Sepulchral Stalkers, Serpent Guard, Necropolis Knights, Tomb Barque and Chariot units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A dream of glory attained through conquest great rages still, despite the dying of the light.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Nehekhara Warriors, Tomb Guards, Skeleton Warriors and Spearmen units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Nehekhara Warriors, Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen and Tomb Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Nehekhara Warriors, Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen and Tomb Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The very strength of the desert, to stand sentinel over the Tomb Kings' domain and crush their enemies to dust.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Ushabti, Scorpion, Skeleton War Elephant, Hierotitan, Necrolith Colossus, Khemric Titan, Necrosphinx and Khemrian Warsphinx units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Ushabti, Tomb Scorpion, Hierotitan, Necrosphinx and Khemrian Warsphinx units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Ushabti, Tomb Scorpion, Hierotitan, Necrosphinx and Khemrian Warsphinx units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Dark litanies are uttered to restore the Tomb Kings' slain soldiers to a twisted, chattering imitation of life.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Some of war's spoils are more difficult to see but are just as valuable as gold or jewels.
This one scours the battlefields, plains and dunes for the vanquished dead, so that his armies may march at full strength once more.
These jars contain the remains of many Liche Priests, which are useful for raising and binding a new force.
Nehekhara's mummified rulers are awake, their eyes burning with balefire, their thirst for power, conquest and vengeance every bit as strong as they were in life.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: By which the Undead armies of Nehekhara may remain deathless, undying and forever hungry for slaughter.

effects.description:
Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -35% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To the victor, the spoils. All of them. Always.

effects.description:
Canopic Jars: +4% gained from battles
	(Lord's army)

Canopic Jars: +9% gained from battles
	(Lord's army)

Canopic Jars: +15% gained from battles
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It stands watch over the land, lest the foe's insidious, opportunistic agents dare to strike.
Renowned among their allies and feared by enemies both mortal and otherwise, this Lord's every deed adds to their already legendary reputation.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit is Undead (does not rout, immune to terror, becomes unstable when Leadership is low).

factionEffects.localised_description: Prince Rakaph III, dynastic heir to the throne of Numas has awoken! Some unworthy Tomb King now sits on the throne of Numas and will not relinquish it to him! This will not stand for the son of King Imrathepis! The legacy of the Crimson King shall be restored! Numas will once again praise King Imrathepis and Prince Rakaph III, not some pretenders to the throne. Seize your legacy, seize the lands of Nehekhara, raise your Warsphinx army of old again and pacify these lands.

effects.description: Hidden Settlements: To outsiders your cities seem like ruins, but few suspect the hive of activity occuring in the catacombs and dormant-looking pyramids...
Chance of ambushing any enemy army this force attacks

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +12 when fighting in desert terrain
	(all armies)
Diplomatic relations: -50 with the faction of  Numas

items.colour_text: This ancient shield bears the endless scratches and pocketholes of millenium of hard use and a thousand arrows stopped. Repaired many times over, the craftsmen and Mortuary Cult of the Rakaph Dynasty have laid powerful enchantments over the shield to protect their Prince from harm.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +3 for Khemrian Warsphinx and Necrosphinx units
	(local province)

items.colour_text: This deathmask attempts to capture the stern yet wise visage of the Prince in unending peace. The Necrotect who carved it enchanted the mask with runes inspriring those loyal to the Prince, while terrifying those who dare face him on the field of combat.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

items.colour_text: It has been said that there have been many crowns, and many kings, of Numas the last few millenium. Those who follow Prince Rakaph III regard all of them pretenders to the throne, drawning great strength and focus from seeing the crown on their beloved Prince's head.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: -300 with the faction of  Numas

items.colour_text: This is the blade that routed an entire Ogre tribe, it's forever cold blade is said to hunger for that blood drenched day again.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Prince Rakaph III's army of over a dozen Khemrian Warsphinx's crushed his father's killers and secured his throne.

ui_effects.localised_text: Activates automatically when conditions are met
Strong vs 25 men unit or above
